remarks:
A nonempty subset of a closed real interval satisfies the conditions for the existence of its supremum (see ~ suprcl ).  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Jan-2008.) 

---

 A nonempty subset of a closed real interval satisfies the conditions for the existence of its supremum.  To be useful without excluded middle, we'll probably need to change not equal to apart, and perhaps make other changes, but the theorem does hold as stated here.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Jan-2008.)
statement:
iccsupr $p |- ( ( ( A e. RR /\ B e. RR ) /\ S C_ ( A [,] B ) /\ C e. S ) -> ( S C_ RR /\ S =/= (/) /\ E. x e. RR A. y e. S y <_ x ) ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B x y $.
$d S x y $.
